messages.message:
Hey, this is great feedback, @Aayush! Some of these things were already on our radar, but this is a nice little list for us to just hit up.

I think my one question about what you’ve raised is that the typeface weight for headers came from the design team and Pollen as weight:700, so if you have any clarification on that, it would be super helpful for us to adjust it. cc: @alagu.
@Aayush this is the header style from pollen. Cc: @tj.serkes
Seems like these are pollen header + bold. I guess it'd make it less jarring if we remove the bold
@Aayush, I guess I’m not seeing the difference that you’re referring to?
Converse empty chat view uses headers without bold
Ah, I see. We can work with the design team if they think changes are needed there. Otherwise, we’ll work on the other refinements you mentioned this week. Thank you again so much!

Thanks! I think it making the headers bold makes sense when we want the header to really stand out. Otherwise, large text does the job for establishing hierarchy. Too much bold takes away user focus. That's why the default is non bold

@Aayush I’m just echoing Jean here, but thanks for noticing and bringing these things to our attention. It’s so rare to get feedback like this. Please let us know if you have more ideas for adjustments.
Empty view is not the same hierarchy as page header.
@jean @Chris Cowell I am not seeing a need for changing the type style, but I maybe missing context. Please connect with @tj.serkes before making any typography related changes
It is possible sub heads can go to regular

Yup I only meant this as a feedback, design team would be able to recommend the best design here.
The default font-weight for the text is 300. Default for headers is 400. If we drop down to medium, that'd be 500 with good contrast with the text (current bold is 700). Bold should also be good, I guessed it'd be worth trying other weights if we have not already.
